name: Shuichi Nagao
career-description: I entered the university of Tokyo in April of 2012, and spent most of my university days on lacrosse. My major was engineering, and I got interested in programming then. Though I proceeded to graduate school in March of 2016, I dropped out in one year, because I was strongly into startup. After dropout I entered AnyPay inc that runs some payment services, as a software engineer. Since fall of 2017 I have been involved in blockchain, or crypto, projects.
career-title-university-entry: April, 2012 | Enter the university of Tokyo
career-university-entry1: Studied liberal arts in scientific class
career-university-entry2: Proceeded to the department of System Innovation, Engineering faculty.
career-internship-candle: As of December in 2015, I started Internship as a software engineer, which drove me to learn programming so hard.
career-title-university-graduation: March, 2016 | Graduate from the university of Tokyo
career-university-graduation: Graduated from the university of Tokyo
career-title-gradschool-entry: April, 2016 | Enter Graduate School (the university of Tokyo)
career-gradschool-entry: Then I was into startup so I stopped studying in graduate school and was dedicated myself to programming to make applications. Through some internships, like mercari, I decided to officially join startup not for internship.
career-title-gradschool-dropout: March, 2017 | Dropout Graduate School (the university of Tokyo)
career-anypay-entry1: I joined AnyPay Inc. as a very first iOS developer. In summer I started to develop server-side of a new project with Ruby. Since fall I have been involved in another new project related to crypto, actually I have been coding React Native.
skills-description: SwiftでのiOS開発、React NativeでのiOS/Androidアプリの開発、そのバックエンドの開発(Ruby)を主に業務で担当している。もともとSwiftが好きだったが、業務でJavaScriptをがっつり触っているうちにJavaScriptへの愛着が湧いてきた。他にもブロックチェーンに関心があるので、Ethereumや他のチェーンの調査や、Solidityを使ったスマートコントラクトの実装をすることもある。
skills-programming: Swift / JavaScript(React, React Native, node.js) / Ruby(Ruby on Rails) / Solidity
hobby-description: My hobby is programming to make something, workout, and travelling. In weekends, I help starups to develop or study blockchain which changes so fast that I'm into it. I like technology that changes our lives. In China, technology really has been changing their lives, which attracts me to visit Shenzhen many times.
hobby-travel: Israel / China（Shenzhen・Shanghai・Hangzhou） / HongKong / the US（San Francisco・Maryland）
work-description: For internship I was involved in media(web, iOS) application for young women, where I developed not only iOS but backend and AWS. After entering AnyPay, my colleagues and I had been working on a new application, called 'paymo', to make it internal project. I experienced work flow with more than 8 people, coding highly maintainable tests, and refactoring from architecture.
work-paymo: The US has 'Venmo', China has 'WeChat Pay' and 'Alipay', however, we Japanese have no applications like that, even though it is necessary in this digital age. So, we struggle to make it possible on application, which is our motivation. At AnyPay, I experienced work flow with more than 8 people, coding highly maintainable tests, and refactoring from architecture. Besides, this app requires comprehension of Japanese money transfer legals, which made me study legals issues.
work-title-mimi: Mimi | Streaming video application for makeup
work-mimi: Development team consisted of 3 people, and I was mainly in charge of server-side(admin web site and API server), though I started to get involved in this product as an iOS developer. We cared about performance and  OOM very much.
work-title-marble: Marble | Content curation for young women
work-marble: This is my very first product as an engineer. At first, I coded PHP to make web site, and then I started to develop iOS client application in Swift.
